meanings.def: to die because you have been underwater too long and you cannot breathe; to kill somebody by holding them underwater
examples: Two children drowned after falling into the river.
He had attempted to rescue the drowning man.
drown somebody/something/yourself She tried to drown herself.
They had drowned the unwanted kittens.
be drowned He was drowned at sea.
She had been thrown into the harbour and left to drown.
They were commended for saving a four-year-old from drowning.

meanings.def: to make something very wet; to completely cover something in water or another liquid
examples: The fruit was drowned in cream.

meanings.def: to be louder than other sounds so that you cannot hear them
examples: She turned up the radio to drown out the noise from next door.
His words were drowned out by jeers and whistling.

meanings.def: to get drunk in order to forget your problems
examples: She opened a bottle of wine to drown her sorrows.

idioms.def: to get drunk in order to forget your problems
examples: She opened a bottle of wine to drown her sorrows.
